185727909.review:
This is the peak of Civilization, I say this as a completely unbiased person. We have MILF Montezuma and GI Jeanne d'Arc, stacks of 20 spearmen treading through nuclear waste, railroad spaghetti so good it'll make your toes curl, man's first interpretation of facial micro- sorry, macro-expressions, ... This game is the meme that keeps on giving and I will forever cherish it. ♥️ 

It's also legitimately fun to play, not just funny. I found Civ 6 so bloated and busy with its many menus and DLCs that it sort of turned me off. I was surprised to return to this fossil of a game and then have more fun with it overall. Civ 3 also has a couple of features that aren't in the series anymore, like having a city view, designing your palace, the civ leaders and your advisors having a wardrobe update every era, ... it has spirit, it's a vibe.

185544093.review:
Мои впечатления:
Первые шаги
Начало игры было относительно спокойным. Строил первые города, исследовал карту, стараясь найти стратегически важные ресурсы. Меня поразила глубина механики: каждый ход нужно было обдумывать, как развивать города, какие технологии исследовать и какие здания строить. Постепенно мои города начали процветать, и я почувствовал настоящую гордость за своё виртуальное государство.

Дипломатия и войны
Особенно мне понравилась дипломатическая система. Когда я встретил другие цивилизации, начались сложные переговоры. Иногда удавалось заключать выгодные союзы, но бывало и так, что неожиданные предательства приводили к войнам. Самое запоминающееся было, когда мой бывший союзник объявил мне войну. Это заставило меня пересмотреть всю свою стратегию и укрепить оборону.

Культура и влияние
Система культуры стала настоящим открытием. Построив несколько культурных зданий, я с удивлением заметил, как соседние города начали переходить под моё влияние без всякой войны! Это дало мне понять, что побеждать можно не только силой, но и с помощью мягкой силы.

Наука и технологии
Процесс исследований также был невероятно увлекательным. Я тратил много времени, пытаясь сбалансировать между военными технологиями и гражданскими. Когда я впервые запустил космический корабль, чтобы достичь звёзд, я испытал настоящий восторг — это был один из путей к победе, который я не ожидал так сильно впечатлит.

Победа и выводы
Моя первая победа была культурной — это был неожиданный, но очень приятный момент. Глядя на свою цивилизацию, я осознал, сколько стратегических решений пришлось принять, чтобы достичь этого результата. Игра действительно заставляет думать на несколько шагов вперёд и оценивать каждое действие.

185313385.review: Um clássico nos jogos de estratégia. Passou pelo Bug do Milênio, pela Panaceia Planetária do Protocolo de Enfrentamento do Covid-19. Oferece uma visão da humanidade e suas descobertas científicas, políticas, militares, religiosas e outras. Conduza sua civilização pelo tempo de tribo nômade a um império, passando pela vila isolada, pequenas cidades, metrópoles,nas eras medievais, grandes descobertas marítimas, colonizações, mercantilismo, pré-industrial, industrial e contemporâneas. Excelente game. Recomendo o modo Hotseat, no qual vc pode conduzir mais de uma civilização e crie outras com a IA (computador)

184960610.review:
Quick Review: This is one the classic Civilization games that, without having fancy graphics or much complex mechanics has its charm. Im not a very seasoned player of this franchise, nor very fond of TBS, and of this genre have only ever played this game and Imperialism II, but i can say without a doubt i had a lot of fun with it, specially when designing my own maps and testing them out. 
It's a easy to learn but hard to master kind of game, at least for me, that has truly keep me busy and trying my best to become the best leader in the world and get the most wonders possible to max out my civilization, hoping that i reach current technology fast before being annihilated by Nuclear Gandhi (jokes, he's not here, i hope).

Quick Score: 8.5/10

184275656.review:
I've been playing this since it was a CD-ROM (i.e. for more than 20 years).  And I have never not been complete crap at it (I guess I just need to play more aggressively). And yet, I find it strangely enjoyable. Here's the rundown:

The good:
The GOAT of "just one more round" gameplay addictiveness.
Will run on a potato.
Games last about 3 hours which is honestly the sweet spot for a 4X game, imho.
No compatibility issues with modern Windows (as of 2024 on a below-spec but new laptop).
Many different options mean this is a sandbox game you can adjust to your needs.
Character portraits are kind of iconic at this point.
Loads up super quickly. You can be back in a saved game in like 10 seconds.

The meh:
Things look pretty small. It doesn't really stretch to modern monitors (at least not on default settings). Hope you brought your glasses...
It's a good thing I've known how to play (poorly) since 2001, because the tutorial is a bit on the skimpy side.
If you're like me and play defensively - as if you're RPing an actual leader - you've got an uphill battle.
If you're full on into military strategy (like I'm not), you're probably going to be a little frustrated by the rather primitive troop management options - at least compared to more recent games.

The verdict:
I booted this up on my work laptop to fill some time during a long holiday with the in-laws. And unlike other games in my queue, this one effortlessly eats up time like nobody's business. If you see it on sale, you owe it to yourself to give this 4X dad game a shot.

Playability / Enjoyment 6/10
Graphics / Sound 2/10
Woke / ESG score 0/10
Story / Writing 2/10
Replayability 8/10

The best thing about this Civ version is how fast it plays.  Being a lot simpler than the later games, you do not have to wait ages for each turn to pass.  The simplicity also is an enjoyment  benefit, as some of the later games (Civ 6) traded fun for complexity in my opinion.

183606734.review: Fully does not work on Windows 11. After fiddling around with the game files and even installing a mod to get it to simply open properly, upon trying to load any map the game just freezes permanently. Perhaps there is an arcane way to get past this hurdle as well, but I'm struggling to justify the effort. As it is this game should come with a warning that it is not expected to function on current operating systems.
